indicator_long_name: Crowding (percent of homes with > 1 person per room), 2017-21
indicator_description: Households with more than one person per room are considered crowded.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Adults ages 18 years and older with asthma in the past 12 months (age-adjusted percent), 2020
indicator_description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues increase risk of developing and triggering asthma.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_name: Adults reporting mice or rats outside
indicator_long_name: Adults reporting rats or mice outside their building (percent), 2010
indicator_description: Mice and rats are a source of household allergens connected to developing or worsening asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Adults reporting second-hand smoke at home (percent), 2012
indicator_description: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at home. Secondhand smoke, especially indoors, is bad for health - particularly for the health of children.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Homes with cracks or holes (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Cracks or holes are a maintenance deficiency linked to the presence of mice, rats, and cockroaches - which can harm residents' health.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Pre-1960 homes with peeling paint (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Older housing (built before 1960) that has peeling paint can put residents at risk of lead poisoning, due to lead paint. Lead paint was banned from household paints in New York City in 1960 and in the USA in 1978.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Homes with leaks (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Leaks are a maintenance deficiency that can harm health by introducing mold, which can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_name: Homes near structures rated good or excellent
indicator_long_name: Homes near structures rated good or excellent (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Building quality predicts the number of housing maintenance deficiencies in a residence that place residents at increased risk of acute or chronic health problems.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Homes using supplemental heat (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The need for supplemental heat may mean a building's main heat source doesn't work - and can indicate the presence of other health-threatening maintenance deficiencies.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_name: Homes with mice or rats in the building
indicator_long_name: Homes with mice or rats in the building (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The presence of mice or rats in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. These pests can contaminate food and worsen asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: People living in poverty (percent), 2015-19
indicator_description: The percent of households with incomes below the federal poverty level. Households without sufficient resources are often deprived of access to items such as health care and good quality housing that are needed to maintain good health.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Homes with cockroaches (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The presence of cockroaches in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. Cockroaches in the home can contaminate food and worsen asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Adults who allow smoking in the home (percent), 2013
indicator_description: Adults without a smoke-free home policy. A smoke-free home policy can limit people's exposure to secondhand smoke, which is especially dangerous to children.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Fine Particulate Matter (PM2.5) (Mean mcg per cubic meter), Annual Average 2021
indicator_description: Fine particles are emitted by vehicles, building boilers, and other combustion - and are a major form of air pollution that harms health.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) (Mean ppb), Annual Average 2021
indicator_description: Nitrogen dioxide is a pollutant formed by combusion that damage lung tissue, cause breathing problems, and contribute to smog and acid rain.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Ozone (O3) (Mean ppb), Summer 2021
indicator_description: Ozone is a common air pollutant that can harm breathing and worsen asthma and other respiratory conditions.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Monthly bicycle use (Percent), 2020
indicator_description: Adults reporting having ridden a bicycle at least once a month in the past year.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Adults reporting exercise in the past 30 days (percent), 2020
indicator_description: Adults reporting exercise in the past 30 days (from when they were surveyed). Regular exercise is a key way to stay healthy.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Adults with overweight or obesity (percent), 2020
indicator_description: People who are overweight or obese are at increased risk for heart disease and diabetes.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Obesity, 2020
indicator_description: People who are obese are at increased risk for heart disease and diabetes. Neighborhood factors such as walkability and the types of food retail outlets available can impact residents' risk of being overweight or obese.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Heat stress emergency department visits (rate per 100,000 residents), 2014
indicator_description: ED visits due to heat-related illnesses, such as heat stroke and heat exhaustion, represent part of the public health burden of extreme heat.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data; United States Census

indicator_long_name: Heat stress hospitalizations (age-adjusted rate per 100,000 residents), 2015
indicator_description: Heat stress hospitalizations due to heat-related illnesses, such as heat stroke and heat exhaustion, represent part of the public health burden of hot weather. Data aggregated over five years provides enough stability to display neighborhood impacts.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data; United States Census

indicator_long_name: Adults reporting mold in the home (percent), 2012
indicator_description: Adults reporting mold in the home. Mold can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma, and indicate maintenance deficiencies in a building.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_name: Adults reporting mice or rats inside
indicator_long_name: Adults reporting mice in the home, 2012
indicator_description: Mice and rats are a source of household allergens connected to developing or worsening asthma.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Deaths due to all causes among adults aged 30 years and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Estimating deaths that can be linked to PM2.5 is a way to understand how air pollution increases mortality.
data_source_list: New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; United States Census ; USEPA Air Quality System; Krewski D, et al. (2009) HEI Research Report 140. Health Effects Institute, Boston, MA

indicator_long_name: Sulfur dioxide (SO2) tons , 2015
indicator_description: Boilers are a common source of SO2, which can worsen lung disease.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Fine particulate matter (PM2.5) tons, 2015
indicator_description: Boilers are a common source of PM2.5, which can harm health.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Nitrogen oxides (NOx) tons, 2015
indicator_description: Boilers are a common source of NOx emissions, which can harm health.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled (VMT) (Per 100 km2 number), 2016
indicator_description: Traffic density is a measure of the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.
data_source_list: New York Metropolitan Transportation Council Best Practice Model

indicator_long_name: Cars, 2016
indicator_description: Traffic density is a measure of the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.
data_source_list: New York Metropolitan Transportation Council Best Practice Model

indicator_long_name: Trucks, 2016
indicator_description: Traffic density is a measure of the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.
data_source_list: New York Metropolitan Transportation Council Best Practice Model

indicator_name: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Benzene Concentrations
indicator_long_name: Benzene (?g/m3), 2011
indicator_description: Benzene is an air pollutant resulting from motor vehicle and industrial emissions and tobacco smoke. Benzene is a known carcinogen that can also harm bone marrow and red blood cell function.
data_source_list: United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Air Quality System (AQS) Data

indicator_name: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Formaldehyde Concentrations
indicator_long_name: Formaldehyde (?g/m3), 2011
indicator_description: Formaldehyde is an air pollutant resulting from car exhaust and the manufacture of industrial products. Formaldehyde is a known carcinogen that can also cause irritation to eyes and lungs and increase risk of asthma and trigger asthma symptoms.
data_source_list: United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Air Quality System (AQS) Data

indicator_name: Asthma emergency department visits due to PM2.5
indicator_long_name: Asthma emergency department visits among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause asthma ED visits, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al. (2007) J Expo Sci Environ Epidemiol 17:S45S60

indicator_long_name: Respiratory hospitalizations in adults aged 20 years and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Estimating hospitalizations that can be linked to PM2.5 is a way to understand how air pollution impacts public health.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Moolgavkar SH (2000) Inhal Toxicol 12(Supp 4):7590; Zanobetti etal.(2009) Environ Hlth 8:58. doi:10.1186/1476-069X-8-58

indicator_long_name: Cardiovascular hospitalizations in adults aged 40 years and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause cardiovascular hospitalizations, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; US EPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al (2011) Environ Hlth Persp, 119(4):467-473

indicator_name: Cardiac and respiratory deaths due to Ozone
indicator_long_name: Deaths due to cardiac and respiratory causes among all residents, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Estimating heart and respiratory deaths that can be linked to ozone is a way to understand how air pollution increases mortality.
data_source_list: New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; United States Census ; USEPA Air Quality System; Huang Y et al. (2005) Environmetrics 16:547562

indicator_name: Asthma emergency departments visits due to Ozone
indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Ozone can cause asthma ED visits, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al. (2007) J Expo Sci Environ Epidemiol 17:S45S60

indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma hospitalizations among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Ozone can cause hospitalizations for asthma, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; US EPA Air Quality System; Silverman RA, Ito K (2010) J Allergy Clin Immun 125(2):367373

indicator_name: Asthma emergency department visits due to PM2.5
indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause asthma ED visits, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al. (2007) J Expo Sci Environ Epidemiol 17:S45S60

indicator_name: Asthma emergency departments visits due to Ozone
indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 years and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Ozone can cause asthma ED visits, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al. (2007) J Expo Sci Environ Epidemiol 17:S45S60

indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma hospitalizations among adults ages 18 years and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Ozone can cause hospitalizations for asthma, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; US EPA Air Quality System; Silverman RA, Ito K (2010) J Allergy Clin Immun 125(2):367373

indicator_long_name: Adults with health insurance, 2020
indicator_description: Health insurance coverage is associated with numerous beneficial health effects. Those with health insurance are more likely to have a regular doctor, receive preventive care services, better manage chronic health conditions, have longer life expectancy, and more.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Bicycle injury emergency department visits (age-adjusted rate per 100,000 residents), 2014
indicator_description: Bicycle injury ED visits can indicate the overall safety of cycling in the city - for transporation or other purposes.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) inpatient data 2016, updated January 2018. NYC DOHMH population estimates, modified from US Census Bureau interpolated intercensal population estimates, 2018, updated September 2019.

indicator_long_name: Pedestrian injury emergency department visits (age-adjusted rate per 100,000 residents), 2014
indicator_description: Pedestrian injury ED visits can indicate the safety of walking for transporation.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) inpatient data 2016, updated January 2018. NYC DOHMH population estimates, modified from US Census Bureau interpolated intercensal population estimates, 2018, updated September 2019.

indicator_long_name: Area located within hurricane evacuation zones 1-6 (percent), 2013
indicator_description: Areas in evacuation zones are at increased risk of flooding during coastal storms. They may be ordered to evacuate in the event of a hurricane or coastal flooding.
data_source_list: New York City Office of Emergency Management

indicator_long_name: Spatial average of surface temperature (Degrees Fahrenheit), 11:22 AM, July 17, 2018
indicator_description: Surface temperatures vary based on vegetative cover (which promotes cooling), as well as by materials that retain heat (like paved roads, sidewalks, and buildings). Hotter neighborhoods tend to have more heat-exacerbated deaths associated with extreme heat events.
data_source_list: U.S. Geological Survey

indicator_long_name: People living below federal poverty level (percent), 2008-2012
indicator_description: Neighborhood poverty measures residents' access to economic stability, education, adequate health care, safe housing and freedom from stress. Neighborhoods with higher poverty tend to have less access to these factors and experience worse health outcomes.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Area with vegetative cover including trees and grass (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Vegetative cover is the land covered by trees, grass, or other plants instead of a hard surface like roads, sidewalks, or buildings. Vegetative cover tends to reduce temperatures in the immediate area and may increase air quality.
data_source_list: University of Vermont remote sensing LiDAR data, assessed using methodology described in: MacFaden, S.W., ONeil-Dunne, J.P.M., Royer, A.R., Lu, J.W.T., & Rundle, A.G. (2012). High-resolution tree canopy mapping for New York City using LiDAR and object-based image analysis. Journal of Applied Remote Sensing, 6(1).

indicator_long_name: Serious psychological distress, 2012
indicator_description: Mental health conditions like series psychological distress can be worsened by extreme weather such as heat waves and coastal storms.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Adults aged 18 and older with independent living difficulty (percent), 2013-17
indicator_description: People with disabilities or access or functional needs may need additional support during extreme weather. For example, they may need extra planning for safe travel out of evacuation zones during a hurricane, or back-up electricity to support medical equipment during power outages. Information provided here about adults with independent living difficulties can help emergency management professionals better prepare our residents for emergencies.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Adults aged 65 years and older who live alone (percent), 2017-21
indicator_description: Older adults are more vulnerable to extreme weather. Those living alone may have more difficulty getting resources they need in an emergency, and are at higher risk of weather-related illnesses like heat stroke and hypothermia.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_name: Asthma in public school children (age 5 to 14)
indicator_long_name: Asthma among public school children ages 5 to 14 years old (per 1,000 children), 2013-2014
indicator_description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues increase risk of developing and triggering asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Automated School Health Records

indicator_long_name: Adults 65+ Reporting Air Conditioning in the Home (Percent), 2013
indicator_description: Older adults (over 65) are more vulnerable to hot weather and heat stress. Air conditioning reduces the risk of heat stroke and other heat-related illness.
nbr_data_note: ** Estimate is suppressed due to insufficient data.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Tree canopy cover (percent of land area), 2014
indicator_description: Tree canopy coverage is the percent of a neighborhood that is shaded by trees. Tree shade can lower a neighborhood's temperatures, can make it more comfortable and attractive to walk and stay active.
data_source_list: The Built Environment & Health Project (BEH), Columbia University

indicator_long_name: Carbon monoxide incidents without a detector (average annual rate per 10,000 buildings), 2014-2016
indicator_description: Carbon monoxide detectors are required in NYC homes by law. Failure to provide or maintain a detector can put people at risk for carbon monoxide poisoning and death.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: Fire Department of New York City (FDNY) Carbon Monoxide Incidents

indicator_long_name: Children under 5 years old in poverty (percent), 2017-21
indicator_description: Poverty is a major determinant of health, since poverty deprives people of access to health and safety resources.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Children under 6 years with elevated blood lead levels (BLL) (Rate  BLL>=5 per 1,000 tested), 2020
indicator_description: Elevated blood lead levels are 5+ mcg/dL. There is no safe level of lead in the blood. Lead poisoning can cause learning and behavior problems, and delay growth and mental development.
data_source_list: New York City Healthy Homes Program

indicator_long_name: Homes reporting air conditioning (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Air conditioning is an important way to avoid heat stress, especially for persons with limited mobility.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Premature mortality (age-adjusted rate per 100,000), 2016
indicator_description: The rate of people who die before age 65 can indicate the overall health of a population.
data_source_list: New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; United States Census

indicator_long_name: Adults perceiving neighborhood as safe from crime (percent), 2016
indicator_description: Adults reporting their neighborhood is safe from crime. Whether people perceive their neighborhood as safe can affect whether they will spend time outside, use parks, and use active and sustainable forms of transportation. It can also affect mental well-being.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Asthma emergency department visits among children ages 5 to 17 years (per 10,000), 2018
indicator_description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 years and older, 2018
indicator_description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Asthma hospitalizations among children ages 5 to 17 years old, 2018
indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Asthma hospitalizations among adults ages 18 years and older, 2018
indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Sidewalk area (percent of land area), 2014
indicator_description: Sidewalks are important for commuting, businesses, and physical activity. Greater sidewalk area can contribute to a safer pedestrian environment, support vibrant business districts and can foster social interaction among residents.
data_source_list: The Built Environment & Health Project (BEH), Columbia University

indicator_long_name: People living in walking distance to a park (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The percentage of the population who live within walking distance to a park: a quarter-mile or less to entrances of smaller sites, such as sitting areas and playgrounds, and half-mile or less to entrances of larger parks. Increased access to green space and open space can contribute to increased levels of physical activity.
data_source_list: New York City Department of Parks and Recreation; New York City DOHMH population estimates, modified from US Census Bureau inter-censal population estimates

indicator_long_name: Streets with bicycle lanes (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Bike lanes can improve bicyclist and pedestrian safety, physical activity, and sustainable transportation use. An increase in percentage of streets with bike lanes can indicate a safer cycling environment in a neighborhood which may increase overall cycling.
data_source_list: New York City Department of Transportation

indicator_name: Walking distance to a subway station
indicator_long_name: People living in walking distance to a subway station (percent), 2018
indicator_description: The percentage of population within a quarter-mile of a subway station entrance. When more people have convenient access to the transit system, they're more likely to use it. Subway access encourages active transportation, which improves the health of residents.
data_source_list: Metropolitan Transportation Authority ; United States Census

indicator_name: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems
indicator_long_name: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Homes with maintenance deficiencies can threaten the health of the people who live there.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_description: People who are overweight or obese are at increased risk for heart disease and diabetes.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Obesity, 2020
indicator_description: People who are obese are at increased risk for heart disease and diabetes. Neighborhood factors such as walkability and the types of food retail outlets available can impact residents' risk of being overweight or obese.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Heat stress emergency department visits (rate per 100,000 residents), 2014
indicator_description: ED visits due to heat-related illnesses, such as heat stroke and heat exhaustion, represent part of the public health burden of extreme heat.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data; United States Census

indicator_long_name: Heat stress hospitalizations (age-adjusted rate per 100,000 residents), 2015
indicator_description: Heat stress hospitalizations due to heat-related illnesses, such as heat stroke and heat exhaustion, represent part of the public health burden of hot weather. Data aggregated over five years provides enough stability to display neighborhood impacts.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data; United States Census

indicator_long_name: Adults reporting mold in the home (percent), 2012
indicator_description: Adults reporting mold in the home. Mold can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma, and indicate maintenance deficiencies in a building.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_name: Adults reporting mice or rats inside
indicator_long_name: Adults reporting mice in the home, 2012
indicator_description: Mice and rats are a source of household allergens connected to developing or worsening asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Deaths due to all causes among adults aged 30 years and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Estimating deaths that can be linked to PM2.5 is a way to understand how air pollution increases mortality.
data_source_list: New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; United States Census ; USEPA Air Quality System; Krewski D, et al. (2009) HEI Research Report 140. Health Effects Institute, Boston, MA

indicator_long_name: Sulfur dioxide (SO2) tons , 2015
indicator_description: Boilers are a common source of SO2, which can worsen lung disease.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Fine particulate matter (PM2.5) tons, 2015
indicator_description: Boilers are a common source of PM2.5, which can harm health.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Nitrogen oxides (NOx) tons, 2015
indicator_description: Boilers are a common source of NOx emissions, which can harm health.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Traffic Density- Annual Vehicle Miles Traveled (VMT) (Per 100 km2 number), 2016
indicator_description: Traffic density is a measure of the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.
data_source_list: New York Metropolitan Transportation Council Best Practice Model

indicator_long_name: Cars, 2016
indicator_description: Traffic density is a measure of the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.
data_source_list: New York Metropolitan Transportation Council Best Practice Model

indicator_long_name: Trucks, 2016
indicator_description: Traffic density is a measure of the average number of vehicles that occupy specified area. Traffic density can influence health as a source of air pollution and traffic-related injuries.
data_source_list: New York Metropolitan Transportation Council Best Practice Model

indicator_name: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Benzene Concentrations
indicator_long_name: Benzene (?g/m3), 2011
indicator_description: Benzene is an air pollutant resulting from motor vehicle and industrial emissions and tobacco smoke. Benzene is a known carcinogen that can also harm bone marrow and red blood cell function.
data_source_list: United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Air Quality System (AQS) Data

indicator_name: Air Toxics Concentrations- Average Formaldehyde Concentrations
indicator_long_name: Formaldehyde (?g/m3), 2011
indicator_description: Formaldehyde is an air pollutant resulting from car exhaust and the manufacture of industrial products. Formaldehyde is a known carcinogen that can also cause irritation to eyes and lungs and increase risk of asthma and trigger asthma symptoms.
data_source_list: United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Air Quality System (AQS) Data

indicator_name: Asthma emergency department visits due to PM2.5
indicator_long_name: Asthma emergency department visits among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause asthma ED visits, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al. (2007) J Expo Sci Environ Epidemiol 17:S45S60

indicator_description: Estimating hospitalizations that can be linked to PM2.5 is a way to understand how air pollution impacts public health.

indicator_long_name: Cardiovascular hospitalizations in adults aged 40 years and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause cardiovascular hospitalizations, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.

indicator_description: Estimating heart and respiratory deaths that can be linked to ozone is a way to understand how air pollution increases mortality.
data_source_list: New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; United States Census ; USEPA Air Quality System; Huang Y et al. (2005) Environmetrics 16:547562

indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma hospitalizations among children under 18 years of age, 2015-2017
indicator_description: Ozone can cause hospitalizations for asthma, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; US EPA Air Quality System; Silverman RA, Ito K (2010) J Allergy Clin Immun 125(2):367373

indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 and older, 2015-2017
indicator_description: PM2.5 can cause asthma ED visits, which represent part of the health burden of fine particle air pollution.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al. (2007) J Expo Sci Environ Epidemiol 17:S45S60

indicator_long_name: Attributable asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 years and older, 2015-2017

data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS); US Census; USEPA Air Quality System; Ito K et al. (2007) J Expo Sci Environ Epidemiol 17:S45S60

indicator_description: Ozone can cause hospitalizations for asthma, which are part of the health burden of air pollution.

indicator_long_name: Adults with health insurance, 2020
indicator_description: Health insurance coverage is associated with numerous beneficial health effects. Those with health insurance are more likely to have a regular doctor, receive preventive care services, better manage chronic health conditions, have longer life expectancy, and more.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Bicycle injury emergency department visits (age-adjusted rate per 100,000 residents), 2014
indicator_description: Bicycle injury ED visits can indicate the overall safety of cycling in the city - for transporation or other purposes.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) inpatient data 2016, updated January 2018. NYC DOHMH population estimates, modified from US Census Bureau interpolated intercensal population estimates, 2018, updated September 2019.

indicator_long_name: Pedestrian injury emergency department visits (age-adjusted rate per 100,000 residents), 2014
indicator_description: Pedestrian injury ED visits can indicate the safety of walking for transporation.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) inpatient data 2016, updated January 2018. NYC DOHMH population estimates, modified from US Census Bureau interpolated intercensal population estimates, 2018, updated September 2019.

indicator_long_name: Area located within hurricane evacuation zones 1-6 (percent), 2013
indicator_description: Areas in evacuation zones are at increased risk of flooding during coastal storms. They may be ordered to evacuate in the event of a hurricane or coastal flooding.
data_source_list: New York City Office of Emergency Management

indicator_long_name: Spatial average of surface temperature (Degrees Fahrenheit), 11:22 AM, July 17, 2018
indicator_description: Surface temperatures vary based on vegetative cover (which promotes cooling), as well as by materials that retain heat (like paved roads, sidewalks, and buildings). Hotter neighborhoods tend to have more heat-exacerbated deaths associated with extreme heat events.
data_source_list: U.S. Geological Survey

indicator_long_name: People living below federal poverty level (percent), 2008-2012
indicator_description: Neighborhood poverty measures residents' access to economic stability, education, adequate health care, safe housing and freedom from stress. Neighborhoods with higher poverty tend to have less access to these factors and experience worse health outcomes.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Area with vegetative cover including trees and grass (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Vegetative cover is the land covered by trees, grass, or other plants instead of a hard surface like roads, sidewalks, or buildings. Vegetative cover tends to reduce temperatures in the immediate area and may increase air quality.
data_source_list: University of Vermont remote sensing LiDAR data, assessed using methodology described in: MacFaden, S.W., ONeil-Dunne, J.P.M., Royer, A.R., Lu, J.W.T., & Rundle, A.G. (2012). High-resolution tree canopy mapping for New York City using LiDAR and object-based image analysis. Journal of Applied Remote Sensing, 6(1).

indicator_long_name: Serious psychological distress, 2012
indicator_description: Mental health conditions like series psychological distress can be worsened by extreme weather such as heat waves and coastal storms.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Adults aged 18 and older with independent living difficulty (percent), 2013-17
indicator_description: People with disabilities or access or functional needs may need additional support during extreme weather. For example, they may need extra planning for safe travel out of evacuation zones during a hurricane, or back-up electricity to support medical equipment during power outages. Information provided here about adults with independent living difficulties can help emergency management professionals better prepare our residents for emergencies.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Adults aged 65 years and older who live alone (percent), 2017-21
indicator_description: Older adults are more vulnerable to extreme weather. Those living alone may have more difficulty getting resources they need in an emergency, and are at higher risk of weather-related illnesses like heat stroke and hypothermia.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_name: Asthma in public school children (age 5 to 14)
indicator_long_name: Asthma among public school children ages 5 to 14 years old (per 1,000 children), 2013-2014
indicator_description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues increase risk of developing and triggering asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Automated School Health Records

indicator_long_name: Adults 65+ Reporting Air Conditioning in the Home (Percent), 2013
indicator_description: Older adults (over 65) are more vulnerable to hot weather and heat stress. Air conditioning reduces the risk of heat stroke and other heat-related illness.
nbr_data_note: ** Estimate is suppressed due to insufficient data.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Tree canopy cover (percent of land area), 2014
indicator_description: Tree canopy coverage is the percent of a neighborhood that is shaded by trees. Tree shade can lower a neighborhood's temperatures, can make it more comfortable and attractive to walk and stay active.
data_source_list: The Built Environment & Health Project (BEH), Columbia University

indicator_long_name: Carbon monoxide incidents without a detector (average annual rate per 10,000 buildings), 2014-2016
indicator_description: Carbon monoxide detectors are required in NYC homes by law. Failure to provide or maintain a detector can put people at risk for carbon monoxide poisoning and death.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: Fire Department of New York City (FDNY) Carbon Monoxide Incidents

indicator_long_name: Children under 5 years old in poverty (percent), 2017-21
indicator_description: Poverty is a major determinant of health, since poverty deprives people of access to health and safety resources.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Children under 6 years with elevated blood lead levels (BLL) (Rate  BLL>=5 per 1,000 tested), 2020
indicator_description: Elevated blood lead levels are 5+ mcg/dL. There is no safe level of lead in the blood. Lead poisoning can cause learning and behavior problems, and delay growth and mental development.
data_source_list: New York City Healthy Homes Program

indicator_long_name: Homes reporting air conditioning (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Air conditioning is an important way to avoid heat stress, especially for persons with limited mobility.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Premature mortality (age-adjusted rate per 100,000), 2016
indicator_description: The rate of people who die before age 65 can indicate the overall health of a population.
data_source_list: New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; New York City Bureau of Vital Statistics; United States Census

indicator_long_name: Adults perceiving neighborhood as safe from crime (percent), 2016
indicator_description: Adults reporting their neighborhood is safe from crime. Whether people perceive their neighborhood as safe can affect whether they will spend time outside, use parks, and use active and sustainable forms of transportation. It can also affect mental well-being.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Asthma emergency department visits among children ages 5 to 17 years (per 10,000), 2018
indicator_description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Asthma emergency department visits among adults ages 18 years and older, 2018
indicator_description: Severe asthma attacks can result in a visit to the ED. Things like smoke, air pollution, dust mites, cockroaches, mold, pollen and pet dander can trigger asthma.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Asthma hospitalizations among children ages 5 to 17 years old, 2018
indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Asthma hospitalizations among adults ages 18 years and older, 2018
indicator_description: Asthma hospitalizations are more severe asthma outcomes. They're often clustered in high-poverty neighborhoods, where disinvestment and poor housing conditions expose residents to triggers.
data_source_list: New York State Statewide Planning and Research Cooperative System (SPARCS) Deidentified Hospital Discharge Data

indicator_long_name: Sidewalk area (percent of land area), 2014
indicator_description: Sidewalks are important for commuting, businesses, and physical activity. Greater sidewalk area can contribute to a safer pedestrian environment, support vibrant business districts and can foster social interaction among residents.
data_source_list: The Built Environment & Health Project (BEH), Columbia University

indicator_long_name: People living in walking distance to a park (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The percentage of the population who live within walking distance to a park: a quarter-mile or less to entrances of smaller sites, such as sitting areas and playgrounds, and half-mile or less to entrances of larger parks. Increased access to green space and open space can contribute to increased levels of physical activity.
data_source_list: New York City Department of Parks and Recreation; New York City DOHMH population estimates, modified from US Census Bureau inter-censal population estimates

indicator_long_name: Streets with bicycle lanes (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Bike lanes can improve bicyclist and pedestrian safety, physical activity, and sustainable transportation use. An increase in percentage of streets with bike lanes can indicate a safer cycling environment in a neighborhood which may increase overall cycling.
data_source_list: New York City Department of Transportation

indicator_name: Walking distance to a subway station
indicator_long_name: People living in walking distance to a subway station (percent), 2018
indicator_description: The percentage of population within a quarter-mile of a subway station entrance. When more people have convenient access to the transit system, they're more likely to use it. Subway access encourages active transportation, which improves the health of residents.
data_source_list: Metropolitan Transportation Authority ; United States Census

indicator_name: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems
indicator_long_name: Renter-occupied homes with any health-related maintenance problems (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Homes with maintenance deficiencies can threaten the health of the people who live there.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Crowding (percent of homes with > 1 person per room), 2017-21
indicator_description: Households with more than one person per room are considered crowded.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Adults ages 18 years and older with asthma in the past 12 months (age-adjusted percent), 2020
indicator_description: Asthma is a common disease characterized by breathing difficulty. Poor air quality and housing issues increase risk of developing and triggering asthma.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_name: Adults reporting mice or rats outside
indicator_long_name: Adults reporting rats or mice outside their building (percent), 2010
indicator_description: Mice and rats are a source of household allergens connected to developing or worsening asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Adults reporting second-hand smoke at home (percent), 2012
indicator_description: Adults reporting secondhand smoke at home. Secondhand smoke, especially indoors, is bad for health - particularly for the health of children.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Homes with cracks or holes (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Cracks or holes are a maintenance deficiency linked to the presence of mice, rats, and cockroaches - which can harm residents' health.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Pre-1960 homes with peeling paint (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Older housing (built before 1960) that has peeling paint can put residents at risk of lead poisoning, due to lead paint. Lead paint was banned from household paints in New York City in 1960 and in the USA in 1978.
nbr_data_note: * Estimate is based on small numbers so should be interpreted with caution.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Homes with leaks (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Leaks are a maintenance deficiency that can harm health by introducing mold, which can worsen respiratory conditions like asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_name: Homes near structures rated good or excellent
indicator_long_name: Homes near structures rated good or excellent (percent), 2017
indicator_description: Building quality predicts the number of housing maintenance deficiencies in a residence that place residents at increased risk of acute or chronic health problems.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Homes using supplemental heat (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The need for supplemental heat may mean a building's main heat source doesn't work - and can indicate the presence of other health-threatening maintenance deficiencies.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_name: Homes with mice or rats in the building
indicator_long_name: Homes with mice or rats in the building (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The presence of mice or rats in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. These pests can contaminate food and worsen asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: People living in poverty (percent), 2015-19
indicator_description: The percent of households with incomes below the federal poverty level. Households without sufficient resources are often deprived of access to items such as health care and good quality housing that are needed to maintain good health.
data_source_list: American Community Survey

indicator_long_name: Homes with cockroaches (percent), 2017
indicator_description: The presence of cockroaches in the home is often associated with poor housing maintenance. Cockroaches in the home can contaminate food and worsen asthma.
data_source_list: New York City Housing and Vacancy Survey (HVS)

indicator_long_name: Adults who allow smoking in the home (percent), 2013
indicator_description: Adults without a smoke-free home policy. A smoke-free home policy can limit people's exposure to secondhand smoke, which is especially dangerous to children.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Fine Particulate Matter (PM2.5) (Mean mcg per cubic meter), Annual Average 2021
indicator_description: Fine particles are emitted by vehicles, building boilers, and other combustion - and are a major form of air pollution that harms health.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) (Mean ppb), Annual Average 2021
indicator_description: Nitrogen dioxide is a pollutant formed by combusion that damage lung tissue, cause breathing problems, and contribute to smog and acid rain.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Ozone (O3) (Mean ppb), Summer 2021
indicator_description: Ozone is a common air pollutant that can harm breathing and worsen asthma and other respiratory conditions.
data_source_list: New York City Community Air Survey

indicator_long_name: Monthly bicycle use (Percent), 2020
indicator_description: Adults reporting having ridden a bicycle at least once a month in the past year.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)

indicator_long_name: Adults reporting exercise in the past 30 days (percent), 2020
indicator_description: Adults reporting exercise in the past 30 days (from when they were surveyed). Regular exercise is a key way to stay healthy.
data_source_list: New York City Community Health Survey (CHS)
